column2:
name
  1. Arpavon (a village in the Drôme department, France)

noun
  1. Saracen (term for a Muslim during the Middle Ages)

verb
  1. to host; to lodge (provide a place to stay)

noun
  1. archer (one who fires arrows from a bow)

noun
  1. (with definite article) the other day (in the recent past)

verb
  1. (reflexive, se caler) to care about; to be concerned about

noun
  1. chamberlain (officer in charge of managing a household)

verb
  1. to convict (someone of a crime, etc.)
  2. to conclude; to finish

noun
  1. Christian (adherent of Christianity)

adj
  1. Christian (adhering to or relating to Christianity)

verb
  1. (reflexive, se dezesperar) to lose hope; to feel hopeless

verb
  1. (transitive) to double (make twice as much or twice as large)
  2. (intransitive) to double (become twice as much or twice as large)

adv
  1. (chiefly with "ne") hardly; almost not at all

adj
  1. generous
  2. large; big
  3. wide (when used to differentiate between height, width and length)

article
  1. the (masculine nominative singular and plural definite article)

verb
  1. (reflexive, se membrar) to recall; to remember

noun
  1. mister, sir (a title or form of address for a man)

noun
  1. currency, coinage
  2. mint (facility for making coins)
  3. kind, sort, type

noun
  1. sir; sire; title given to a nobleman. Compare English monsieur, a loan from French of the same origin

name
  1. Christmas (date commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ)

noun
  1. night (period of darkness while the Earth's surface is turned away from the Sun)

noun
  1. man (adult male human being)
  2. vassal

pron
  1. (indefinite) Used to indicate an unspecified individual: one, people, you, someone

verb
  1. (transitive) to weigh (measure the weight of)
  2. (intransitive) to weigh (have a certain weight)
  3. (transitive) to bother; to worry

verb
  1. (usually of the Sun) to shine; to emit light

verb
  1. to admire, especially with affection or desire

verb
  1. to turn green again (of trees, plants, etc.)

noun
  1. (as a term of address), sir; sire
  2. lord or other noble person

verb
  1. to serve (act as a servant or a vassal)

verb
  1. to sun; to expose to the sun

adv
  1. such; so much; to such and extent

adj
  1. such; so much

verb
  1. (transitive) to turn (to rotate or reorient)
  2. (with en) to turn into

verb
  1. to humble
  2. (reflexive, s'umiliar) to humble oneself (to act humbly)

verb
  1. (reflexive, se venjar) to avenge oneself, to take revenge

noun
  1. orchard, or other place where fruit is grown

adv
  1. in the presence of, in sight of
